TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirements of the experiment to know the name/Click the continue button to start the experiment.
Gloves are taken from the box.
Wear the gloves properly.
Sample water is collected from the pond.
The bottle is closed.
A tissue paper is taken from the box.
The sample bottle is wiped well with tissue paper.
The bottle is placed in the work bench.
The glove is removed.
Discarded into the waste bin.
A glove is taken from the box.
Wear the glove.
The bottle is taken from the work bench.
The sample bottle is labeled as ‘Test sample’.
Again the bottle is replaced in the work bench.
The sample bottle is taken from the work bench.
Open it.
The water sample is transferred into a measuring cylinder.
The water sample is transferred into a measuring cylinder.
The empty bottle is placed into the workbench.
The measuring cylinder with test sample (500ml) is taken from the workbench.
The water sample is transferred into the BOD bottle labeled as Test sample.
A pipette is taken from the rack.
A pipette pump is inserted into the pipette.
2ml of manganese sulphate is taken from the beaker using pipette.
Sodium sulphate is transferred into the BOD bottle containing test sample.
A pipette is taken from the rack.
A pipette pump is inserted into the pipette.
2ml of alkaline iodide azide solution is taken from the bottle using pipette.
Alkaline iodide azide solution is transferred into the BOD bottle containing test sample.
The solution is mixed well.
After mixing, the bottle is replaced into the workbench.
Kept it as such for few minutes to settle out.
A pipette is taken from the rack.
A pipette pump is inserted into the pipette.
2ml of Conc.Sulphuric acid is taken from the bottle using pipette.
Conc.Sulphuric acid is transferred into the BOD bottle containing test sample.
notext
The sample in the bottle is kept in the BOD incubator for 5 days incubation.
The sample in the bottle is kept in the BOD incubator for 5 days incubation.
notext
5 days incubation.
After incubation, the incubator is opened.
The bottle is taken out from the incubator.
The incubator is closed.
The bottle is replaced into the workbench.
A 50ml measuring cylinder is taken from the workbench.
notext
notext
The bottle is opened and is taken from the workbench.
50 ml of sample solution is taken from the bottle using measuring cylinder.
Measured sample is transferred into a conical flask labeled as ‘Test sample 1’.
The measuring cylinder is replaced into the workbench.
Again 50 ml of sample solution is taken from the bottle using measuring cylinder.
50 ml of sample solution is taken from the bottle using measuring cylinder.
50 ml of sample solution is taken from the bottle using measuring cylinder.
Measured sample is transferred into a conical flask labeled as ‘Test sample 2’.
The measuring cylinder is replaced into the workbench.
notext
The burette is placed into the stand.
A funnel is taken from the workbench.
The funnel is placed into the burette.
The standard flask with 0.025N Sodium thiosulphate is taken from the workbench.
The burette is filled with 0.025N Sodium thiosulphate.
The standard flask is replaced into the workbench.
The funnel is removed from the burette.
Replaced in the workbench.
The conical flask with test sample 1 is taken from the workbench.
The sample 1 is placed on the stirrer below to the burette.
A stir bar is put into the conical flask.
The stirrer is switched on.
The stop cock is released to add the Sodium thiosulphate from the burette to the sample. When the solution turns pale yellow color, close the stopper.
The indicator starch solution is taken from the bottle using a dropper.
When adding 3 drops of starch solution the solution turns blue in color.
Again release the stop cock until the color changes from blue to colorless. After that, the stop cock is closed.
Note the reading.
Similarly titrate the ‘Test sample 2’ and note the reading as shown in the table.
notext
